column4: I have an amd sempron but for some reason only the 64 packages install properly??  any ideas?
so you need a 32bit version of ubuntu
what version of ubuntu did you install, and where are you getting the packages from ?
ok, and you installed the 32bit version, and used the 32bit edgy repositories ?
you must have changed /etc/apt/sources.list to do the upgrade
it already has them then i guess
chances are you can only use it in the machine it came with then, unless it was a retail boxed version
oh sure, it will work, but the licence forbids you
you'll need antivirus on linux or any other platform too once it becomes a viable target
well yeah, but has a trial
not legally no. you can re-start the trial on windows too if you want
yeah, xfce is great for older machines
its nice, but there are a few quirks still for me - switched to KDE just to make my desktop more usable
